subject: Productivity
title: What Are Heuristics
description: A quick, practical guide to What Are Heuristics.

hook.text: You choose a restaurant by how busy it looks. That shortcut saves time but can mislead.

buildup.text: Heuristics are mental shortcuts the brain uses to make quick judgments without full analysis.

discovery.text: Tversky and Kahneman identified dozens of heuristics that guide everyday thinking.

twist.text: Heuristics work most of the time. But in unfamiliar situations, the shortcuts produce systematic errors.

climax.text: The key isn't avoiding heuristics. It's knowing when to override them with slower analysis.

punchline.text: Shortcuts save time until they cost you.
